intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius vaccarii, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in grassy areas, meadows, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are yellow, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it produces small, elongated achenes as seeds. Hieracium vaccarii is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its resilience to environmental stress.
